newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL shares end higher with secondaries in lead.
newsitem.headline: KL shares end higher with secondaries in lead.

text.p: The surge of secondary stocks led the Kuala Lumpur market to a higher finish, with blue chips lifted by late-afternoon buying.
Dealers said secondaries were the main focus as many second board counters hit new highs for the year.

The Second Board index ended at 625.10 points, up 7.58 points or 1.23 percent despite the sharp fall of Repco Holdings. "People say the next target is 650. It's not very difficult to push the small-cap second boards," said a Mayban Securities trader. The blue-chip focused Composite Index was up 1.97 points to 1,175.98.
Second boarders Dataprep, Fourseason, Esprit, Poly Glass and Tamadam rose to intraday highs for the year.
Repco fell 5.50 ringgit or 6.4 percent to 80.50. Its chief executive officer was charged with violating a securities law. He pleaded not guilty to the accusation of making a misleading statement.
Weak blue chips were saved by afternoon buying led by foreign institutions, GK Goh Stockbrokers said in its market report.
Proton, expected to post strong half-year earnings, rose 30 cents to 15.30.
